bibl.title: Howard McMillen v. O. D. Butterfield. Petition for writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: Washington State Archives, Puget Sound Regional Branch

div1.p:
In the Disctrict Court of the Third Judicial of Washington Territory, Holding Terms at Seattle in King County,
In the Matter of the Application of Edward Crofrey Howard McMillen Petition for writ

FOR A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS.
To the Hon. C. H. Hanford, chief Justice of Washington Territory and Judge of the above entitled court. The petition of Edward Grofrey Howard McMillen respectfully shows That he, the said Edward Crofrey Howard McMillen is unlawfully imprisoned, detained, confined and restrained of his liberty by one O. D. Buterfield Chief of Police and keeper of the kail of the city of Seattle in said King County Washington Territory.

That the said imprisonment, detention confinement and restraint are i legal and that the illegality thereof consists in this to wit: That there is no complaint or information on file in any court of this territory charging this petitioner with the commission of any crime. That this petitioner has seen so illegaly confined, imprisoned, restrained, and detained for the space of g 12 hours, without having had the privillage of a hearing or allowed the right to furnish tail. Therefore, your petitioner pray that a writ of Habeas corpus may be granted, directed to the said O. D. Buterfield Chief of Police as aforesaid, commanding him to have the body of the said Edward Grofrey Howard McMillen before your Honor at a time and place therein to be specified, to do and receive what shall then and there be consideredby your Honor, concerning said. Edward Grofrey Howard McMillentogether with the time and cause of his detention, and said writ; and that he Edward Grofrey Howard McMillenmay be restored to his liberty.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 10 day of May A. D. 1889 H. F. Jones Notary Public in and for Washington Territory.
